segment.source: ms.ContentId: D1D4969F-52FD-43A2-982B-B531B0343D2B
segment.target: ms.ContentId: D1D4969F-52FD-43A2-982B-B531B0343D2B

segment.source: title: Troubleshooting
segment.target: title: Troubleshooting

segment.source: Troubleshoot Hyper-V on Windows 10
segment.target: Troubleshoot Hyper-V on Windows 10

segment.source: I updated to Windows 10 and now I can't connect to my downlevel (Windows 8.1 or Server 2012 R2) host
segment.target: I updated to Windows 10 and now I can't connect to my downlevel (Windows 8.1 or Server 2012 R2) host

segment.source: 12-Nov update.
segment.target: 12-Nov update.

segment.source: In Windows 10, Hyper-V manager moved to WinRM for remote management.
segment.target: In Windows 10, Hyper-V manager moved to WinRM for remote management.

segment.source: What that means is now Remote Management has to be enabled on the remote host in order to use Hyper-V manager to manage it.
segment.target: What that means is now Remote Management has to be enabled on the remote host in order to use Hyper-V manager to manage it.

segment.source: For more information see Managing Remote Hyper-V Hosts
segment.target: For more information see Managing Remote Hyper-V Hosts

segment.source: I changed the checkpoint type, but it is still taking the wrong type of checkpoint
segment.target: I changed the checkpoint type, but it is still taking the wrong type of checkpoint

segment.source: If you are taking the checkpoint from VMConnect and you change the checkpoint type in Hyper-V manager the checkpoint taken be whatever checkpoint type was specified when VMConnect was opened.
segment.target: If you are taking the checkpoint from VMConnect and you change the checkpoint type in Hyper-V manager the checkpoint taken be whatever checkpoint type was specified when VMConnect was opened.

segment.source: Close VMConnect and reopen it to make it take the correct type of checkpoint.
segment.target: Close VMConnect and reopen it to make it take the correct type of checkpoint.

segment.source: When I try to create a virtual hard disk on a flash drive, an error message is displayed
segment.target: When I try to create a virtual hard disk on a flash drive, an error message is displayed

segment.source: Hyper-V does not support FAT/FAT32 formatted disk drives since these file systems do not provide access control lists (ACLs) and do not support files larger than 4GB.
segment.target: Hyper-V does not support FAT/FAT32 formatted disk drives since these file systems do not provide access control lists (ACLs) and do not support files larger than 4GB.

segment.source: ExFAT formatted disks only provide limited ACL functionality and are therefore also not supported for security reasons.
segment.target: ExFAT formatted disks only provide limited ACL functionality and are therefore also not supported for security reasons.

segment.source: The error message displayed in PowerShell is "The system failed to create '\[path to VHD\]': The requested operation could not be completed due to a file system limitation (0x80070299)."
segment.target: The error message displayed in PowerShell is "The system failed to create '\[path to VHD\]': The requested operation could not be completed due to a file system limitation (0x80070299)."

segment.source: Use a NTFS formatted drive instead.
segment.target: Use a NTFS formatted drive instead.

segment.source: I get this message when I try to install: "Hyper-V cannot be installed: The processor does not support second level address translation (SLAT)."
segment.target: I get this message when I try to install: "Hyper-V cannot be installed: The processor does not support second level address translation (SLAT)."

segment.source: Hyper-V requires SLAT in order to run virtual machines.
segment.target: Hyper-V requires SLAT in order to run virtual machines.

segment.source: If you computer does not support SLAT, then it cannot be a host for virtual mahchines.
segment.target: If you computer does not support SLAT, then it cannot be a host for virtual mahchines.

segment.source: If you are only trying to install the management tools, unselect Hyper-V Platform in Programs and Features > Turn Windows features on or off.
segment.target: If you are only trying to install the management tools, unselect Hyper-V Platform in Programs and Features > Turn Windows features on or off.
